info.title: News Aggregator API
info.description: A RESTful API for managing news articles and user preferences, built with Laravel 11, Sanctum authentication, Redis caching, and rate limiting (60 requests/minute per IP).

get.description: Returns a paginated list of articles with optional filters for keyword, date, category, and source.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Search keyword to filter articles by title, content, or summary

title.example: Colorado Springs pet related information and events starting Feb. 22

summary.example: Pet related information and events in and around the Colorado Springs area

message.example: Too many requests. Please try again later.

get.description: Returns details of a specific article identified by its hashed ID, cached for 30 minutes.

title.example: Nicole Kidman Believes Gender Parity in Hollywood Only Comes From \u2018Actually Being in the Films of Women\u2019

summary.example: In 2017, Kidman vowed to work with a female director every 18 months and has since exceeded that quota.

message.example: User registered successfully. Please verify your email to log in.

422.description: Validation failed.(note: Each field returns only one error message at a time, showing possible validation errors for the given fields.)

example: The email has already been taken.
The email must be a valid email address.
The name must not exceed 255 characters.
The password must be at least 8 characters.
The password must contain at least one uppercase letter.
The password must contain at least one number.
The password must contain at least one special character.

message.example: Too many requests. Please try again later.
Please verify your email address before logging in.

post.description: This endpoint generates a password reset token for a given email address. The token can be used to reset the user's password.

email.description: The email address of the user requesting a password reset.

message.example: Password reset token generated. Use this token to reset your password.

404.description: No user found with this email address.

message.example: No user found with this email address.

items.example: The email must be a valid email address.

get.description: Returns the authenticated user's preferences, cached for 15 minutes. If no preferences are set, 'data' will be null.

200.description: Preferences retrieved successfully or no preferences set yet

message.description: Will be 'Preferences retrieved successfully' if preferences exist, or 'No preferences set yet' if none exist

data.description: User preferences if set, otherwise null

post.description: Creates or updates the authenticated user's preferences, clearing relevant Redis caches. Each preference field is a comma-separated string, where individual values should match existing records in the articles table (sources, categories, authors).

preferred_sources.description: Comma-separated list of preferred news sources. Each source must exist in the 'source' column of the articles table.

preferred_categories.description: Comma-separated list of preferred categories. Each category must exist in the 'category' column of the articles table.

preferred_authors.description: Comma-separated list of preferred authors. Each author must exist in the 'author' column of the articles table.

items.example: The preferred_sources must be a string.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of articles based on the authenticated user's preferences, cached for 15 minutes.

title.example: Nicole Kidman Believes Gender Parity in Hollywood Only Comes From Actually Being in the Films of Women

summary.example: In 2017, Kidman vowed to work with a female director every 18 months and has since exceeded that quota.

message.example: No preferences set. Please set preferences first.
